purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then send this data to external domains via HTTP GET requests.
flows: MAC addresses -> Buffer.from() -> base64 encoding -> HTTP request
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains in array _tmp_2
Sending system information to external domains without user consent
Potential data exfiltration through HTTP requests
analysis: This code collects sensitive system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user details. It then sends this data to multiple hardcoded external domains using unverified HTTPS requests. The presence of multiple C2 domains and the use of rejectUnauthorized: false indicates potential malicious intent. The code also uses base64 encoding for data transmission which could be an attempt to obfuscate the payload.
conclusion: This code demonstrates clear signs of malicious behavior including system information gathering and unauthorized data exfiltration to third-party servers.
